bow: my daughter is driving me nuts hey moms having hard time right now my daughter is one and half and she an absolute nightmare she hits me and throws stuff at me she constantly getting into everything she screams and has meltdowns in public try to engage with her by playing with her but she ends up hitting me or throwing toys at me she threw her breakfast on the floor this morning take her to mommy and me classes and she kicks and screams when getting her to participate she just wants to run around ve tried different things but nothing is helping it to the point where wake up dreading my day with her and count down the minutes until my husband gets home do love my daughter but just do like her very much at this stage understand she going into being toddler and some of this behavior is part for the course but it does make it any easier feel very guilty for feeling this way but just tired any body else feel similar people can be bit much kids are people kids can be bit much she your human but still human and humans can be too much sometimes no guilt maybe try to institute some boundaries something like 123 magic or any consistent plan you feel is right for your family also more exercise in an environment she can be more free to be wild like park chasing ball etc when my son started this he did lot better in an open space like big park with me just walking slowly in his direction horror movie killer style he would run 4x as far as me from all the zigzagging gave up on parent child classes after he turned because he just tried to do his own thing and wouldn focus on the activity choosing instead to randomly bolt from the room he also likes to go on hikes with me so he can explore on his own terms taking him out of his comfort zone can slow him down and get him to focus also he does well swimming at the with me she sounds like little fire cracker how is your mood and your tone of voice and interactions with her kids without vocab often react outwards it their way of communicating expect that if this has been going on wi hole it hard for you to put on serene good humoured voice expect you are stressed to bits could be wrong but would be maybe she is reacting to that at this stage and you are both in bad circle kids need set boundaries or they ll react and push till they meet them but without knowing what that are doing maybe that is what she is doing she doesn have reasoning she doesn have words and she doesn know how to to change her pattern so you have to find the patience to help her does she have set in stone every day routine does she sleep enough she doesn neither do you without knowing enough about your situation highly recommend save your sleep by tizzie hall or some how to do routine step by step it so hard to stay patient and bouncy when things are tough but more than likely if you can find that place in you and radiate those feelings then she will feel it and chill out ❤️ hope that makes sense right there with you my son is 20 months and hits us and himself throws stuff and is whining way too much need vacation don have any this will fix it advice because my daughter was very different at that age but what helps us lot when she acting out right now at years old is time outs even just short moment seems to change her attitude completely and also notice she ll act out lot more when she bored or tired so we make sure she has some time to run around or play on the playground or physical activities like that and try to have some crafty activities around playdoh finger paint making fairy wings making drawing etc for when she bored and needs little stimulation set program to each day helps too when the day is predictable for kid it gives them lot of peace so same nap time everyday same meal times etc dont know if you have the financial means but there is no shame in putting your kid in daycare for day week or more if needed it teaches them lot about behaving well and being kind too hang in there and don be afraid to ask for help from family or friends even if it means them watching her for an hour so you can have quiet drive and grab coffee keep yourself sane do time ins so grab his arms straight jacket style wrap my legs around his legs while he sits on my lap and sternly say no you never hit he will scream and flail but hold him quietly until he calms down or warn him that we will sit here until he calms down it the best consequence for any behavior if you are at the mall you can sit with him and say okay time in so they dont have the hissy fit on the floor run away from you it teaches them how to calm themselves when they are upset what ever they were doing is not okay yet mom is here hugging you threw it while you whisper what they did was wrong you can sit there as long as it takes now you can warn them do you need time in and my son will calm himself down before it escalates started it around that age and my son is now he stopped hitting having public freak outs hissy fits if he ever hit me would gently but firmly slap the top of his hand or grab his hand and slap my hand making him think it was his hand and say dont you ever hit see that doesnt feel nice have 16 month old and can tell the time is fast approaching that will have to start doing all of this to him when my kids went through this phase and we were out would leave acting out at playgroup time to go throwing tantrum in the store we are leaving go back later by myself to finish shopping hitting mom time out whichever method you choose be consistent if you remove her from one thing and she acts up at the next thing for instance do try to stay it out it so sucks ve been there but have good news they do turn back into awesome people hang in there agree with this op some kids are high energy and sort of just need to move about more than others like my year old son sitting and directing these in activities can only go on for so long if they re not willing mine does much better after being run around in park or kids play area at least once day can ask how you protect him from bugs and ticks on hikes my daughter is like your son and she is very sensitive to bug bites but she loves loves loves to run and explore mommy and me classes do work for us for the same reasons as you but also worry about ticks here they re very dangerous highly recommend janet lansbury website and podcast her advice drastically changed my interactions with my toddler this is not normal behavior for kid that age in my experience of course little ones throw tantrums yell scream throw fits etc but hitting you and throwing things at you is absolutely unacceptable not even once on my third kid and was child care worker in year old room for long time and ve never even seen child do that to an adult can absolutely see why you would dread interacting with her have you discussed this with pediatrician or psychologist first of all good on you for reaching piggy and recognizing this is phase and not an essential part of her being you might check out janet lansbury she has lot of good advice regarding toddler patenting this sounds just like my son we basically let him run around in circles in fields it effective most importantly it gets better at that age we basically lived at the park we would eat breakfast park til lunch then lunch and nap then after nap time we *maybe* could do an indoor activity but if not back outside he still at almost has more energy than he knows what to do with lol same go on lot of walks with our toddler where she gets to walk wherever she wants within reason and safely it great way to get her energy out think she likes the power of decided where to go and it calms her toddlers want to feel like they have control so it helped us when offered choices both of which were acceptable to me for example do you want to walk or do you want me to carry you riding the scooter or whatever is not an option do you want to wear fleece pants for purple jeans the weather is too cold for shorts so you get to choose from there items my kids did do well in class settings until about and even then it was acceptable for the kids to do their own thing for example my 16 month old son would play on the slide while the class was doing music it was more disruptive to the class to force him to participate even now my kids go to outdoor preschool where the children vote on what the class does for the day for example do hike or stay and hunt for insects the children feel empowered and are much more engaged and less likely to act out psychologist maybe you never had chance to interact with high energy kids every child is different and just think ops baby needs different outlet for their energy and curiosity as with the hitting they re babies and don really know how to channel their emotions into proper responses can you give short example not trying to diagnose anything because not doctor and my only experience with this age is with my nieces and nephews my kids are only 10 months but maybe talk to her doctor about it maybe he she will have some tips or can check for adhd my niece has adhd and is totally different kid on medicine she was diagnosed at years old figure talking to her dr ca hurt right this is an awesome comment my son is going thru thing right now with molars coming in it too hot for anything outside for more than 20mins and days have been so long seconded very consistent routine this means if she melts down and resists the routine you have to continue to enforce it until she gives in as painful and hard as that is know had 30 kids in my kindergarten class last year many fitting the description of your daughter and the only possible way to get them in any sort of positive behaviour pattern as group was consistency and routine also super highly recommend reading how to talk so little kids will listen it really provides some perspective hmm disagree hitting or swatting phase is normal they aren necessarily trying to hurt they are trying to figure out what to do when things don go their way it phase and they need to learn that it isn ok but phase nonetheless also kids can act very different towards child care worker vs their own parents so it not weird that they didn hit swat yes her methods have definitely helped me deal with my son found myself losing my temper with him and wanting to hit him when he hit me but knew how counterproductive it was so that was my oh need some help moment and just listening to her book no bad kids has helped me so much would also highly recommend janet podcast is this just kids being kids through the eyes of child everything is new and exciting they should be expected to pay attention to one thing for long periods especially toddlers let her explore take her to park or open play place and let her run around ve recently seen lotion at target that supposed to repel mosquitoes and ticks unsure of how effective it is and do remember what it was called but maybe looking up bug repellent lotion would help ticks long pants and socks help big time try to find light weight for summer time see if you can find kids bug repellant usually you spray on their clothes ideally not their skin like said do know my nieces all have adhd so do really know what non adhd kid is like at that age except one nephew who just really chill all of the time if it helps one of my best friends met at mommy and me class where we took turns with our 18 month olds trading meltdowns and reassuring each other that it was ok am so surprised you ve never seen child hit or throw things at an adult maybe you re super lucky 🤷🏻‍♀️ that type of behavior is actually very normal for kids under they don have the skills yet to verbally communicate what they want or how they are feeling if told my pediatrician that my 2yo hits and throws things at me wouldn be surprised if he laughed and said something along the lines of yes he two aw how do you guys react what do you do for discipline have this problem at times so far she only hits me 14 month old when frustrated and tell her no and taught her to softly rub my face after hitting so now she just hits then says rub rub after😆 yeah hitting tantrums excessive crying are super normal at this age they have so many thoughts and emotions that ca be expressed correctly and it overwhelming as hell imagine being frustrated about something not working the way you thought it would but having no way to communicate or ask for an explanation because you literally ca and all you ll hear is what wrong what wrong do cry you re okay everyone would pitch fit in that situation hitting is basically them saying do like this this pisses me off and do know how to tell you or what to do about it psychologist or pediatrician would say the same thing in my experience my daughter did not go through this phase yay but know it normal and they ll need time to be taught how to handle their emotions and that hitting is not okay would really recommend telling parents ti consider seeing doctor for possible adhd if you re unsure of how year old behavior is typically like this too shall pass if you have parks near you take her there if you live too far and do have transportation take her outside even if you live in an apartment building it ll help to just let her run around while you follow behind because you get break from her little attitude and she gets to focus on new and cool things outside give you huge hug it ll get better to echo what others have said some kids are just super high energy and their little selves haven quite got handle on how they process that plus toddlerhood which is hard going even with the most zen child my youngest daughter who is just coming up to turning is exactly like this as well as being an animated feeler high energy high emotion so here are my suggestions as parent of six nearly seven find fun sweet way to wake your daughter up each day or implement something if she wakes you up getting kid in good mood for the day really helps make big deal about saying good morning and give her plenty of cuddles you can play song or video that she likes and have her dancing whilst she waits for breakfast for mealtimes there are plenty of kid dishes with suction thing underneath that sticks to the high chair table counter so that babies and toddlers can throw them use them keep drinks at all times in non spill sippys until kids become little more civilised stop going to your group at least for now maybe you enjoy it but probably the amount of stress brought about by going isn worth it head outside your garden parks playgrounds soft play hikes children are lot like dogs they need exercise especially high energy kids try to get the main portion of exercise after any afternoon nap you ll see the benefit from that at bedtime keep good routine it doesn need to be scheduled because life but the routine should pretty much stay consistent regardless of other plans that come along same bedtime same wake up breakfast lunch nap dedicated play time maybe specifically for you and your daughter one on one same supper time same quiet wind down time before bed etc wind down time for high energy kids is really important no tv or electronics hour before bed keep the household energy calm have bath time read story plenty of cuddles when kids have good and consistent play of the day to expect that gives them reassurance confidence and less curveballs that can produce tantrums give your child acceptable choices so she feels like she has some control if there are options for lunch or what you re going to play give her the choice toddlerhood is not too early for discipline this is the time they start pushing boundaries because they ve figured out that they re their own person and they can at least try to say no things like naughty step or corner if something unacceptable happens is useful even if the child won stay put the message gets sent never give in to whining and don go back on your word that applies to every stage of parenthood specifically when your child hits you know that sucks but that toddlerhood tell your child that you re really sad that she hit you and that you love her and like her but you don like what she did tell her you like her to say sorry and not do it again nothing else until she apologised given hug etc tell your husband things have been difficult the above tips will really help but implementation of things until they stick can take time you have to gun for it but you re already drained make sure your husband gives you little time for yourself to do something for you on regular enough basis go shopping go on hike go to the salon something relaxing and rejuvenating don waste your me time on something like catching up with family or friends if they have their own stuff going on you could go home more mentally drained than when you left unless that your jam you do you just do something restorative make sure your husband is totally on board with the routine when he at home unity is imperative don be hard on yourself parenthood is hard toddlerhood is very hard this phase won last promise like said not trying to diagnose anything just saying they may have tips for behavior know ton of people who see the dr when they feel at their witts end and get help tips from their dr just saying it could hurt if it gets to that point not trying to tell her there anything wrong with her daughter just know that with my kids it nice to get reassurance from the lookout for more ☺️ would suggest choosing your battles with her if there are things you feel strongly about choose punishment and be consistent for me would tolerate when my son hit me and he got time out every time he learned after week or two of course do just let other things go but this is what worked for me yes second this that consistency is the most important at that age it just total anarchy if you re in parent child class that actually expects toddler to sit still then would find different one my son goes to little gym and basically it just toddlers running around climbing on stuff and the adults are the ones doing the group stuff and they can participate if they want the plate throwing is super normal they ll outgrow it but suction bowls are really helpful and we found my son throws the plates lot less now that he isn strapped into his high chair and can get out when he wants they also make suction type place mat plates just find way to feel calm in the chaos kids bug repellent and rash guard with long sleeves sometimes kids have high sensory seeking needs and have lot of trouble sitting still and being calm kids like that need high impact proprioceptive information coming through their joints hence kicking and hitting and running some exercise that helps resolve this behavior could be something like the trampoline park toddler soccer programs ours is called little kickers gymnastics so sorry know it exhausting we have giant patio and we bring bubbles and sidewalk chalk out and let her draw everywhere and blow bubbles when she asks she learning to blow bubbles herself now at 20 months we also have slide and some gym mats down so she can climb and tumble around she never been hitter tantrum haver but we also have very hammered down routine with some sort of outside time after her nap everyday so she knows she gets her run around time on weekends we go to playground and just follow her around and help when she needs it but mostly just have her run off energy we stop and get coffee on the way and it become nice family routine in the daytime we do building with mega blocks hide and seek reading books watching some educational shows she knows colors some abcs and counts to 10 think working her brain helps use old boxes and fill them with balls and other toys and let her draw all over the boxes while she sits in them and we also got the magic markers and coloring books where the markers only draw on special paper so that she can take them anywhere that keeps her occupied for while she loves drawing now we also do lot at the public library letting her pick out books going to the story times it all free and entertains her lot also local museums and gardens have been helpful membership is totally worth it at this age for kids museum or discovery space usually just take mine outside when he getting bit much either with stroller or just running around looking at stuff in the grass or walking our dog he finds million things to do and becomes much more tractable with other things also make sure she getting enough sleep that really affects my little dude moods also turn everything you can into game sing song voice make yourself clown doing silly things socks on your head making silly faces pretending to fall down if it diaper change get mine laughing when ask him where the diaper goes and put it on my face or my shoulder or elbow etc dad here my year old is similar would say she quite that bad but does get upset easily when she upset she yells broods hits kicks and shoves even her year old sister and says things like do like you go away go to your room kids especially toddlers are often simply jerks it not our fault and there nothing we can do about it shy of trying to gently curb behavior and waiting for them to grow out of it know you re getting lot of flack for you comment but its not bad advice young children can have mental health needs too if op is really overwhelmed and feels like the behaviors are the same as other kids her child age then she should talk to doctor or therapist for some additional support an early childhood mental health therapist and have worked with children as young as 11 months therapy is always just sitting in chair and talking about your feelings sometimes young children have very different temperaments than their parents and it causes lot of strife amp headbutting if op feels like she tried everything and done everything she can think of definitely consider looking for child amp family therapist your doctor should be able to guide you to the right place or your insurance company ditto once read meme that said something like parenting is just wearing them out until naptime then wearing them out until bedtime with and year old that is basically my life these have been three biggest things for me staying calm when my toddler is upset just because he upset does not mean have to be if we are leaving the park and he losing it walking over and calmly saying know you re sad that we have to leave the park but it time to go and carrying him to the car without trying to convince him to see it my way or yelling or getting myself worked up will make him lot calmer they feed off our emotions calmly acknowledging his feelings which covered in number get on his level and saying hear you know you re sad makes surprising difference in his behavior lot of times they just want to be heard when he about to do something like hit or throw things hold his wrist and say can let you hit mama or can let you throw that she says they do these things because they are out of control and it is reassuring that you are taking it for them they don want to be bad and calmly asserting that you are going to help them from doing it will help we have neighborhood pool and it literally my jam wearing her out twice day in pool she also likes to run so count her running back and forth before we start bedtime 10 wind sprints has made bedtime go
